title: Design Chapel - base for cut out font?
content:
Hi,

Can anybody tell me what what used as the basis for the 'DCHPL-2' and 'PORTFOLIO' on this site:  
 [http://www.designchapel.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011191708/http:/www.designchapel.com/ "http://www.designchapel.com/") - image attached also.

Looks like they've used something as a basis and modified it and filled in the counters - but what?

Any help greatly appreciated!

Thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 17.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011191708/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%2017_12.png) | 77.37 KB |
author: davver79

comments.content:
Whatever it is, it would be a great "masculine" companion to the feminine... sheesh, I can't find it now! :-/ What's that font where the letters are chubby squares and the negative spaces are delicate little spirals?

hhp

Robert Lindström wrote about it here:  
 [http://designchapel.com/blog/2008/12/21/case-000-black-nun-bold-typography/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131011191708/http:/designchapel.com/blog/2008/12/21/case-000-black-nun-bold-typography/ "http://designchapel.com/blog/2008/12/21/case-000-black-nun-bold-typography/")

Guerella - Thank you very much!

hrant - Thanks - would be interested to know the "masculine" companion if you remember!
